intro: Centaurium spicatum var. condensatum, commonly known as the denseflower centaury, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, grasslands, and along stream banks, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
